sentence.Network_en: With Wagner and Beethoven, the classicist and romanticist Brahms dominated the music of the 19 th century.
sentence.Network_cn: 与瓦格纳和贝多芬一道称霸19世纪乐坛的还有德国古典派和浪漫派作曲家布拉姆斯.

PerfectNetExp.abs: classically 古典主义地classicist 古典学者classicize 作成古典式
lyricist 抒情诗人classicist 古典学者，古典主义者neoclassicist 新古典主义者
classicism 古典主义，古典风格classicist 古典主义者，古典崇拜者classification （１）分类，分级；（２）分类法；（３）类别，等级.
古典派(classicist)所谓的「文化」,是和「野蛮」相对的。他们以为,野蛮人的进化程度是和吸收古犯一文化的程度成正比的,如果他们能够全部吸收,他们就不再被称为.

list.abs: Reynolds established the classicist writing principles , but his aesthetic idea was influenced by the British empiricist aesthetics .雷诺兹奠定了古典主义艺术创作的法则，但他的美学思想又受到了英国经验主义美学的影响。
classicisme 古典主义, classicists 经学家, classicisms 古典主义

entry.tran: (尤指研究古希腊、古罗马的语言、文学、哲学的)古典学者，古典文化研究者
entry.def: A classicist is someone who studies the ancient Greek and Roman civilizations, especially their languages, literature, and philosophy.

entry.tran: (尤指建筑等艺术领域的)古典主义者
entry.def: In the arts, especially in architecture, a classicist is someone who follows the principles of classicism in their work.

means.word_mean: 1. an artistic person who adheres to classicism
2. a student of ancient Greek and Latin
